In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **U** serves the following purposes:

- u represents a [unicorn](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn") or [horse](/wiki/Horse "Horse"):

  - u [white unicorn](/wiki/White_unicorn "White unicorn")
  - u [gray unicorn](/wiki/Gray_unicorn "Gray unicorn")
  - u [black unicorn](/wiki/Black_unicorn "Black unicorn")
  - u [pony](/wiki/Pony "Pony")
  - u [horse](/wiki/Horse "Horse")
  - u [warhorse](/wiki/Warhorse "Warhorse")

- U represents an [umber hulk](/wiki/Umber_hulk "Umber hulk"), which is the only member of the [umber hulk](/wiki/Umber_hulk_\(monster_class\) "Umber hulk (monster class)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class").

* It is also used as a [direction](/wiki/Direction "Direction") key if [numpad](/wiki/Numpad "Numpad") movement is off:

  - Press [u]() to move north-east.
  - Press [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [u]() to move far north-east.

- If numpad movement is on:
  - Press [u]() to [untrap](/wiki/Untrap "Untrap").

* In the [source code](/wiki/Source_code "Source code"), the global variable named `u`, of type `struct you`, contains player-specific data.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [2.3 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [2.4 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [2.5 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.6 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [2.7 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [2.8 notdNetHack](#notdNetHack)
  - [2.9 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [2.10 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [2.11 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [3 References](#References)

## Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), the unox used the u glyph, while the ugod used the U glyph; in the variant Hack for PDP-11, the U glyph is instead given to the umber hulk, while the ugod replaced the unox as u. In [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), the u glyph is given to the unicorn.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces new monsters that use the u and U glyphs:

- u unicorn:

  - u [Pegasus](/wiki/Pegasus "Pegasus")
  - u [Nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Nightmare (SLASH'EM)")

- U umber hulk:
  - U [water hulk](/wiki/Water_hulk "Water hulk")

### GruntHack

[GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack") introduces one new monster that uses the u glyph:

- u [Nightmare](/index.php?title=Nightmare_\(GruntHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Nightmare (GruntHack) (page does not exist)")

### SporkHack

[SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack") introduces new monsters that use the u and U glyphs:

- u unicorn or horse:
  - u [nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare_\(SporkHack\) "Nightmare (SporkHack)")
- U umber hulk:
  - U [shambling horror](/wiki/Shambling_horror "Shambling horror")

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") introduces one new monster that uses the U glyph:

- U [shambling horror](/wiki/Shambling_horror "Shambling horror")

### dNetHack

dNetHack adds several new monsters that use the u and U glyphs - the U glyph is used for [unknown abominations](/wiki/Unknown_abomination "Unknown abomination"), a new [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that replaces the umber hulk monster class; the umber hulk is still present as U.

The new monsters include:

- u unicorn or horse:
  - u [Nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare "Nightmare")

- U unknown abomination:

  - U [hooloovoo](/wiki/Hooloovoo "Hooloovoo")
  - U [shambling horror](/wiki/Shambling_horror "Shambling horror")
  - U [stumbling horror](/wiki/Stumbling_horror "Stumbling horror")
  - U [wandering horror](/wiki/Wandering_horror "Wandering horror")
  - U [Nameless Horror](/index.php?title=Nameless_Horror\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Nameless Horror (page does not exist)")
  - U [uvuudaum](/wiki/Uvuudaum "Uvuudaum")
  - U [beauteous one](/wiki/Beauteous_one "Beauteous one")
  - U [Grue](/wiki/Grue "Grue")

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), the U glyph represents [aberrations](/wiki/Aberration "Aberration") instead of umber hulks - the umber hulk is still present as U. The following monsters are changed to use U as a glyph:

- U [mind flayer](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer") (formerly h)
- U [master mind flayer](/wiki/Master_mind_flayer "Master mind flayer") (formerly h)
- U [quantum mechanic](/wiki/Quantum_mechanic "Quantum mechanic") (formerly Q)
- U [genetic engineer](/wiki/Genetic_engineer "Genetic engineer") (formerly Q)

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds new monsters that use the u and U glyphs:

- u unicorn or horse:
  - u [selkie](/index.php?title=Selkie_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Selkie (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")

- u [nightmare](/index.php?title=Nightmare_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Nightmare (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")

- u [pale horse](/index.php?title=Pale_horse_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pale horse (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")

- u [white horse](/index.php?title=White_horse_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "White horse (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")

- u [black horse](/index.php?title=Black_horse_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Black horse (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")

- U umber hulk:

  - U [umbral hulk](/wiki/Umbral_hulk "Umbral hulk")
  - U [hunger hulk](/wiki/Hunger_hulk "Hunger hulk")
  - U [slumber hulk](/index.php?title=Slumber_hulk\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Slumber hulk (page does not exist)")
  - U [shambling horror](/wiki/Shambling_horror "Shambling horror")

### notdNetHack

[notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") retains the monsters added in dNetHack and adds another monster that uses the u glyph:

- u [Lokoban Pinata](/wiki/Lokoban_Pinata "Lokoban Pinata")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") also includes the [shambling horror](/wiki/Shambling_horror "Shambling horror"), as well as several other monsters that use the u glyph:

- u unicorn or horse:

  - u [lesser nightmare](/wiki/Lesser_nightmare "Lesser nightmare")
  - u [nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare_\(EvilHack\) "Nightmare (EvilHack)")
  - u [cauchemar](/wiki/Cauchemar "Cauchemar")
  - u [pegasus](/wiki/Pegasus_\(EvilHack\) "Pegasus (EvilHack)")
  - u [greater pegasus](/wiki/Greater_pegasus "Greater pegasus")
  - u [Pale Horse](/index.php?title=Pale_Horse_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pale Horse (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")
  - u [White Horse](/index.php?title=White_Horse_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "White Horse (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")
  - u [Black Horse](/index.php?title=Black_Horse_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Black Horse (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")
  - u [Red Horse](/index.php?title=Red_Horse\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Red Horse (page does not exist)")

- U umber hulk:
  - U [shambling horror](/wiki/Shambling_horror "Shambling horror")

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") retains the new monsters that use the u and U glyphs in SLASH'EM and adds other new monsters:

- u unicorn or horse:
  - u [young unicorn](/index.php?title=Young_unicorn\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Young unicorn (page does not exist)")

- U umber hulk:

  - U [umbral hulk](/wiki/Umbral_hulk "Umbral hulk")
  - U [hunger hulk](/wiki/Hunger_hulk "Hunger hulk")

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds several monsters that use the u and U glyphs:

- u unicorn or horse:

  - u [lesser nightmare](/wiki/Lesser_nightmare "Lesser nightmare")
  - u [greater nightmare](/wiki/Greater_nightmare "Greater nightmare")
  - u [cauchemar](/wiki/Cauchemar "Cauchemar")
  - u [selkie](/index.php?title=Selkie_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Selkie (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")
  - u [pegasus](/wiki/Pegasus_\(EvilHack\) "Pegasus (EvilHack)")
  - u [greater pegasus](/wiki/Greater_pegasus "Greater pegasus")
  - u [Nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Nightmare (SLASH'EM)")

- U umber hulk:

  - U [umbral hulk](/wiki/Umbral_hulk "Umbral hulk")
  - U [hunger hulk](/wiki/Hunger_hulk "Hunger hulk")
  - U [slumber hulk](/index.php?title=Slumber_hulk\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Slumber hulk (page does not exist)")
  - U [water hulk](/wiki/Water_hulk "Water hulk")
  - U [shambling horror](/wiki/Shambling_horror "Shambling horror")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/decl.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 257](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/decl.h#L257)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [include/you.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 273](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/you.h#L273)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

U

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter U serves the following purposes:

  • u represents a unicorn or horse:
    • u white unicorn
    • u gray unicorn
    • u black unicorn
    • u pony
    • u horse
    • u warhorse
  • U represents an umber hulk, which is the only member of the umber hulk monster class.
  • It is also used as a direction key if numpad movement is off:
    • Press u to move north-east.
    • Press shift + u to move far north-east.
  • If numpad movement is on:
    • Press u to untrap.
  • In the source code, the global variable named u, of type struct you, contains player-specific data.[1][2]

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 GruntHack
    • 2.3 SporkHack
    • 2.4 UnNetHack
    • 2.5 dNetHack
    • 2.6 xNetHack
    • 2.7 SpliceHack
    • 2.8 notdNetHack
    • 2.9 EvilHack
    • 2.10 SlashTHEM
    • 2.11 Hack'EM
  • 3 References

Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, a variant of Jay Fenlason's Hack, the unox used the u glyph, while the ugod used the U glyph; in the variant Hack for PDP-11, the U glyph is instead given to the umber hulk, while the ugod replaced the unox as u. In Hack 1.0, the u glyph is given to the unicorn.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces new monsters that use the u and U glyphs:

  • u unicorn:
    • u Pegasus
    • u Nightmare
  • U umber hulk:
    • U water hulk

GruntHack

GruntHack introduces one new monster that uses the u glyph:

  • u Nightmare

SporkHack

SporkHack introduces new monsters that use the u and U glyphs:

  • u unicorn or horse:
    • u nightmare
  • U umber hulk:
    • U shambling horror

UnNetHack

UnNetHack introduces one new monster that uses the U glyph:

  • U shambling horror

dNetHack

dNetHack adds several new monsters that use the u and U glyphs - the U glyph is used for unknown abominations, a new monster class that replaces the umber hulk monster class; the umber hulk is still present as U.

The new monsters include:

  • u unicorn or horse:
    • u Nightmare
  • U unknown abomination:
    • U hooloovoo
    • U shambling horror
    • U stumbling horror
    • U wandering horror
    • U Nameless Horror
    • U uvuudaum
    • U beauteous one
    • U Grue

xNetHack

In xNetHack, the U glyph represents aberrations instead of umber hulks - the umber hulk is still present as U. The following monsters are changed to use U as a glyph:

  • U mind flayer (formerly h)
  • U master mind flayer (formerly h)
  • U quantum mechanic (formerly Q)
  • U genetic engineer (formerly Q)

SpliceHack

SpliceHack adds new monsters that use the u and U glyphs:

  • u unicorn or horse:
    • u selkie
  • u nightmare
  • u pale horse
  • u white horse
  • u black horse
  • U umber hulk:
    • U umbral hulk
    • U hunger hulk
    • U slumber hulk
    • U shambling horror

notdNetHack

notdNetHack retains the monsters added in dNetHack and adds another monster that uses the u glyph:

  • u Lokoban Pinata

EvilHack

EvilHack also includes the shambling horror, as well as several other monsters that use the u glyph:

  • u unicorn or horse:
    • u lesser nightmare
    • u nightmare
    • u cauchemar
    • u pegasus
    • u greater pegasus
    • u Pale Horse
    • u White Horse
    • u Black Horse
    • u Red Horse
  • U umber hulk:
    • U shambling horror

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM retains the new monsters that use the u and U glyphs in SLASH'EM and adds other new monsters:

  • u unicorn or horse:
    • u young unicorn
  • U umber hulk:
    • U umbral hulk
    • U hunger hulk

Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds several monsters that use the u and U glyphs:

  • u unicorn or horse:
    • u lesser nightmare
    • u greater nightmare
    • u cauchemar
    • u selkie
    • u pegasus
    • u greater pegasus
    • u Nightmare
  • U umber hulk:
    • U umbral hulk
    • U hunger hulk
    • U slumber hulk
    • U water hulk
    • U shambling horror

References

  1. ↑ include/decl.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 257
  2. ↑ include/you.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 273

rawPage:
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the letter '''U''' serves the following purposes:

* {{white|u}} represents a [[unicorn]] or [[horse]]:
** {{monsymlink|white unicorn}}
** {{monsymlink|gray unicorn}}
** {{monsymlink|black unicorn}}
** {{monsymlink|pony}}
** {{monsymlink|horse}}
** {{monsymlink|warhorse}}
* {{white|U}} represents an [[umber hulk]], which is the only member of the [[Umber hulk (monster class)|umber hulk]] [[monster class]].

* It is also used as a [[direction]] key if [[numpad]] movement is off:
** Press {{kbd|u}} to move north-east.
** Press {{kbd|shift|u}} to move far north-east.

* If numpad movement is on:
** Press {{kbd|u}} to [[untrap]].

* In the [[source code]], the global variable named <tt>u</tt>, of type <tt>struct you</tt>, contains player-specific data.{{refsrc|include/decl.h|257|nethack=3.6.7}}{{refsrc|include/you.h|273|nethack=3.6.7}}

==Historical uses==
In Hack 1.21, a variant of [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], the unox used the {{white|u}} glyph, while the ugod used the {{white|U}} glyph; in the variant Hack for PDP-11, the {{white|U}} glyph is instead given to the umber hulk, while the ugod replaced the unox as {{white|u}}. In [[Hack 1.0]], the {{white|u}} glyph is given to the unicorn.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] introduces new monsters that use the {{white|u}} and {{white|U}} glyphs:

* {{white|u}} unicorn:
** {{monsymlink|Pegasus}}
** {{monsymlink|Nightmare|variant=SLASH'EM}}
* {{white|U}} umber hulk:
** {{monsymlink|water hulk}}

===GruntHack===
[[GruntHack]] introduces one new monster that uses the {{white|u}} glyph:

* {{monsymlink|Nightmare|variant=GruntHack}}

===SporkHack===
[[SporkHack]] introduces new monsters that use the {{white|u}} and {{white|U}} glyphs:

* {{white|u}} unicorn or horse:
** {{green|u}} [[Nightmare (SporkHack)|nightmare]]
* {{white|U}} umber hulk:
** {{brightcyan|U}} [[shambling horror]]

===UnNetHack===
[[UnNetHack]] introduces one new monster that uses the {{white|U}} glyph:

* {{brightcyan|U}} [[shambling horror]]

===dNetHack===
dNetHack adds several new monsters that use the {{white|u}} and {{white|U}} glyphs - the {{white|U}} glyph is used for [[unknown abomination]]s, a new [[monster class]] that replaces the umber hulk monster class; the umber hulk is still present as {{monsym|umber hulk}}.

The new monsters include:

* {{white|u}} unicorn or horse:
** {{orange|u}} [[Nightmare]]
* {{white|U}} unknown abomination:
** {{blue|U}} [[hooloovoo]]
** {{brightgreen|U}} [[shambling horror]]
** {{yellow|U}} [[stumbling horror]]
** {{red|U}} [[wandering horror]]
** {{magenta|U}} [[Nameless Horror]]
** {{brightmagenta|U}} [[uvuudaum]]
** {{white|U}} [[beauteous one]]
** {{black|U}} [[Grue]]

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], the {{white|U}} glyph represents [[aberration]]s instead of umber hulks - the umber hulk is still present as {{monsym|umber hulk}}. The following monsters are changed to use {{white|U}} as a glyph:

* {{magenta|U}} [[mind flayer]] (formerly {{monsym|mind flayer}})
* {{brightmagenta|U}} [[master mind flayer]] (formerly {{monsym|master mind flayer}})
* {{cyan|U}} [[quantum mechanic]] (formerly {{monsym|quantum mechanic}})
* {{green|U}} [[genetic engineer]] (formerly {{monsym|genetic engineer}})

===SpliceHack===
[[SpliceHack]] adds new monsters that use the {{white|u}} and {{white|U}} glyphs:

* {{white|u}} unicorn or horse:
** {{green|u}} [[Selkie (SpliceHack)|selkie]]
* {{red|u}} [[Nightmare (SpliceHack)|nightmare]]
* {{gray|u}} [[Pale horse (SpliceHack)|pale horse]]
* {{gray|u}} [[White horse (SpliceHack)|white horse]]
* {{gray|u}} [[Black horse (SpliceHack)|black horse]]
* {{white|U}} umber hulk:
** {{black|U}} [[umbral hulk]]
** {{red|U}} [[hunger hulk]]
** {{blue|U}} [[slumber hulk]]
** {{brightcyan|U}} [[shambling horror]]

===notdNetHack===
[[notdNetHack]] retains the monsters added in dNetHack and adds another monster that uses the {{white|u}} glyph:

* {{cyan|u}} [[Lokoban Pinata]]

===EvilHack===
[[EvilHack]] also includes the [[shambling horror]], as well as several other monsters that use the {{white|u}} glyph:

* {{white|u}} unicorn or horse:
** {{green|u}} [[lesser nightmare]]
** {{green|u}} [[Nightmare (EvilHack)|nightmare]]
** {{green|u}} [[cauchemar]]
** {{white|u}} [[Pegasus (EvilHack)|pegasus]]
** {{white|u}} [[greater pegasus]]
** {{gray|u}} [[Pale Horse (EvilHack)|Pale Horse]]
** {{gray|u}} [[White Horse (EvilHack)|White Horse]]
** {{gray|u}} [[Black Horse (EvilHack)|Black Horse]]
** {{red|u}} [[Red Horse]]
* {{white|U}} umber hulk:
** {{brightcyan|U}} [[shambling horror]]

===SlashTHEM===
[[SlashTHEM]] retains the new monsters that use the {{white|u}} and {{white|U}} glyphs in SLASH'EM and adds other new monsters:

* {{white|u}} unicorn or horse:
** {{gray|u}} [[young unicorn]]
* {{white|U}} umber hulk:
** {{black|U}} [[umbral hulk]]
** {{red|U}} [[hunger hulk]]

===Hack'EM===
[[Hack'EM]] adds several monsters that use the {{white|u}} and {{white|U}} glyphs:

* {{white|u}} unicorn or horse:
** {{green|u}} [[lesser nightmare]]
** {{green|u}} [[greater nightmare]]
** {{green|u}} [[cauchemar]]
** {{green|u}} [[Selkie (SpliceHack)|selkie]]
** {{white|u}} [[Pegasus (EvilHack)|pegasus]]
** {{white|u}} [[greater pegasus]]
** {{monsymlink|Nightmare|variant=SLASH'EM}}
* {{white|U}} umber hulk:
** {{black|U}} [[umbral hulk]]
** {{red|U}} [[hunger hulk]]
** {{blue|U}} [[slumber hulk]]
** {{monsymlink|water hulk}}
** {{brightcyan|U}} [[shambling horror]]
